name: Forwards
description:
Suggestion of How to Play this:
As the designer behind this, I suggest playing this is alone where you can take your time and experience this.
I'm hoping this adds a bit of positivity and brightness into your life.

This is intended for "First Person Shooter" players who use WASD controls... kind of... you'll see.
----------------------------------------------------------------
Controls:
The gameplay for PC players is looking around with the mouse and moving with the WASD keys, kind of.
Players can use a controller, just use the joysticks for movement and looking around. There are Haptics for the controller
----------------------------------------------------------------
Game Intent:
As you move through the game, you'll "Discover" things and through that discovery, I hope to take you on a journey of looking inside your life.

"Forwards" is an expression of my personal journey as a designer.
----------------------------------------------------------------
Playtime: Approximately 1 min
Average playtime is about a minute with the game instantly starting and immediately closing when it's over. There is no menu.
----------------------------------------------------------------
Note on Playthrough:
Some people have gotten stuck and taken longer and some people have gone through missing parts of it. I took the consideration of making the game easier to playthrough at the potential cost of players going through it the wrong way. Still, I hope the majority of players are able to experience the fullness of this game.
----------------------------------------------------------------
Reminder:
This is an prototype for an experiential linear narrative walking sim.
----------------------------------------------------------------
Spoilers and Inspiration:
The Backwards level in the Beginner's Guide. I altered the level, the narrative, the controls, and added a few lighting changes of my own that I hope, tells it's own story and differentiates it from that level.
